bullets.text: Trump expands 50% steel and aluminum tariffs to 407 additional products, escalating protectionism and supply-chain costs across manufacturing.
S&P affirms U.S. credit rating; expects tariff revenue to offset tax bill’s fiscal hit, easing deficit concerns near term.
Japan’s July exports fell 2.6%, steepest drop in 4+ years, signaling global demand softness and potential drag on Asia equities.
Nvidia says it’s evaluating “variety of products” after report of new China AI chip, underscoring shifting U.S.-China tech export constraints.
Databricks valued above $100 billion in latest funding, reinforcing investor appetite for AI infrastructure despite broader market volatility.
Apple increases iPhone production in India amid geopolitical tensions, accelerating supply-chain diversification away from China.
Palo Alto Networks’ earnings beat boosts confidence in cybersecurity demand, signaling resilient enterprise IT spending.
Home Depot says tariffs will raise prices on select goods; home improvement demand remains solid despite margin pressures.
Senior living supply lags surging demand as boomers age, tightening occupancy and supporting rent growth, with investment implications.
U.S. accuses India of profiteering from Russian oil, spotlighting sanctions leakage and energy trade realignment.
Trump signals Ukraine “security guarantees” short of troops, potentially shifting burden to Europe and reshaping NATO commitments.
Shape-shifting single-atom catalyst enables adaptive activity for greener chemistry, promising more efficient industrial reactions.
Experimental cancer vaccine eradicates tumors in mice; early results warrant cautious optimism pending human trials.
Critical cache poisoning flaw disclosed in Dnsmasq threatens DNS integrity across embedded devices and routers; patch urgency is high.
